features: Take on bedwetting accidents and wake up confident with Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear from Pampers, the #1 Pediatrician recommended brand
Exclusive Pampers LockAway Channels absorb wetness quickly & evenly for powerful All-Night Leak Protection and dryness
OdorMask Technology conquers bed-wetting odors continuously for stress-free mornings
FormFit Waistband flexes and stretches to fit older kids best with sleek 360° design
QuietCloth Material minimizes noise for a discreet experience
Breathable Comfort helps keep skin cool like real cotton underwear
0% parabens and latex* for sensitive skin (*Natural rubber)
body.description: Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear… from Pampers, the #1 pediatrician recommended brand! Take on bedwetting accidents and wake up confident with our All-Night Leak Protection. Our exclusive Pampers LockAway Channels absorb and distribute wetness quickly & evenly for powerful protection and dryness. Our built-in OdorMask Technology activates when bedwetting accidents happen to help conquer smells—so kids can wake up feeling great each day. Ninjamas are also uniquely designed for kids with a FormFit Waistband that flexes for a sleek, underwear-like fit. Our super stealthy nighttime underwear discreetly fits around kids' waist and sides and provides breathable comfort, just like cotton underwear!

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Not Alone If your child wets the bed they’re not alone. Five to seven million kids in the U.S. alone wet the bed some nights or most nights. And, although challenging, bedwetting is normal in child development and simply a part of growing up for many kids. Common Causes of Bedwetting Your child could just be a deep sleeper and not awaken to the sign of a full bladder.Their bladder may be too small to hold urine through the night, or communication between the brain and bladder is still developing.Constipation can put pressure on your child’s bladder and lead to problems both holding and emptying urine.Mild illness or stress in your child’s life can cause them to wet the bed, or it could be related to a family history of bedwetting. Tips for Managing Bedwetting Be honest—Remember it’s not your child’s fault. It’s just a normal part of some kids’ development. So be honest with your child and let them know it’s not their fault, and they’ll most likely outgrow it soon.Stay positive—Be sensitive to your child’s feelings and offer support. If you don’t make a big deal about it, chances are they won’t either.Note habits & set a routine—Be aware of your child’s daily urine and bowel habits. Limit large amounts of fluids (especially sugary and carbonated drinks) before bed and have your child use the toilet right before getting into bed. If possible wake your child 1–2 hours after going to sleep to go again.Protect their bed—Even under the best circumstances, accidents aren’t always preventable. And when they do happen, nighttime protective underwear like Ninjamas help keep your child and their bed dry while controlling urine odor. When to See Your Doctor Bedwetting is a common childhood issue, but below are some instances when you may want to talk with your doctor. Your child has been completely toilet trained for 6 months and starts wetting the bed.While urinating, your child experiences pain, burning, or strain, or dribbles after urination.You notice your child’s urine is cloudy or pink, or they have bloodstains on their underwear.Your child has both daytime and nighttime wetting or has poor bowel control.

FAQ's What sizes do Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear come in? Ninjamas are available in sizes S/M and L/XL. S/M fits children 38–70 lb. (17–32 kg), and L/XL fits children 64–125 lb. (29–57 kg). What causes bedwetting? Bedwetting is common in childhood development. It affects 5–7 million children in the U.S. alone. The causes of bedwetting vary from child to child, but the most common cause is normal bladder development. To better understand your child's bedwetting, talk with your child’s nurse or pediatrician. Is there a difference in the protection provided in the pink and green packs of Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear? Both the green and pink Ninjamas packs feature the same superior overnight absorbency with Pampers Lockaway Channels. The only difference is the nighttime underwear designs offered in each pack. So no matter which designs your child prefers, they’ll wake up feeling Ninjawesome! How do Ninjamas Nighttime Underwear absorb wetness? Absorbent gelling material (AGM) is widely used in bedtime underwear padding to absorb wetness and lock it away. It is perfectly normal to see some gel on the skin from time to time, especially if the bedtime underwear is heavily saturated. It can easily be removed by wiping your child's skin. This material has a long history of safe use in a variety of products and has been in Pampers products for more than a decade.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2022
reviews.reviewText: Not 100% leakproof so don’t let your kid drink a 2 liter before bed lol. With other pull-ups and diapers my son would leak out frequently. With ninjamas he has only leaked out once and we just finished our second box. It’s been about 75 days and I’ve only had to wash wet sheets on one occasion. They are much softer than other pull-ups brands and they have a fresh light powder smell that is nice and not overpowering. I rate these 99.8/100. My kid has been in disposable butt covers for 8 years and these are the top of the line. They are also a little cheaper than the good nites brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great for overnight protection
reviews.reviewText: My 6 year son is a very deep sleeper and needs overnight protection. Other brands of pull-ups used to bother him so much however these are lightweight and comfortable. These have held up to his nighttime pee incidents and we have not had any leaks.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: These are great .they are discreet. And they are slim fit and and not bulky .they are super absorbent and they don't leak at all .I will be buying more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Read the reviews for sizing
reviews.reviewText: I’m glad I didn’t go off the box weight for which size to buy, they would’ve been way too tight. My child is 3ft & 50lbs and we did the large and they fit perfect & comfy

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: They certainly do what they’re supposed to and keep my child dry. And frequently we might have a little gap that causes a small leakage. They do seem to not take a lot of wear and tear and have had a few sides that looked a little worn even from one use. Still worth of money though.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love these! A little expensive though
reviews.reviewText: We love these they work beautifully! Just wish they were easier on my pocketbook… or that they had rewards for repeat consumers

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Bought these for grandson who normally wears pull ups. They tend to leak so I thought I'd give these a try. I'm pleased to say that we had ZERO leaks during his two week stay! Recommend!!!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Ninja leakprpof underwear ! Name says it at all. I have used other brands underwear for my son, but this brand is the best sp far. The elastic is soft and stretchable, does not pok him at night, other brands he kept on complaining. I love these and I know you will too.

reviews.reviewTitle: Works as good as goodnites brand for us
reviews.reviewText: I have always used goodnites for YEARS- and totally swear by them for my kids for holding leaks in overnight. Took a chance to give these a try (seen a lot of reviews stating they suck ) but I’d figure I’d try for myself since these were a bit cheaper this time around than my usual brand I bought the large and find they fit the same as goodnites size large for my son. Have only been using a week now but no leaks so I’m extremely happy with them - I would buy again if I need too and only if they’re cheaper than the other ones since nowadays with most of us it’s all about saving money(or it is with me anyways with all the price gouging going on ) only thing I DO NOT LIKE ABOUT THESE AND ITS NOT A BIG DEAL BREAKER IS THE DESIGNS AND COLORS — quite ugly for a boy actually . Kinda pinkish greenish Color’s are the ones I received , but that’s nitpicking to me . They are soft and do have a light scent to them as well. Which I don’t mind scented diapers as it doesn’t affect my kids any and helps keep the pee smell down a tad but not much) however some people may not like that feature .
Love these. True to size, good absorbency, good coverage.
Happy to catch these on sale. My child finds them comfortable. Keeps her dry, she hasn’t wet through them.
My boy pees alot at night and these hold up excellent! Just wish they didn't have a scent. Not needed in my opinion.
